intro: Anagyris barbata, commonly known as the hairy burr legume, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its woody stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds. Anagyris barbata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and efficient water use. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and native landscaping.
